TunableVariant.name: _AB_interval_decay_rates
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will allow AB Testing to switch the interval decay rate for this stat using an AB Testing ID that Analytics provides. NOTE: This is intended as a temporary solution for EP16. If you are working with this tuning after EP16, please talk to an engineer for the correct solution.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The AB ID that Analytics provides.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of decay rate overrides. Whenever the value of the stat falls into this range, the decay rate is overridden with the value specified. This overrides the base decay, so all decay modifiers will still apply. The ranges are inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound. Overlapping values are not allowed and will behave in an undefined manner.

TunableTuple.description: The interval/decay_override pair.

Tunable.name: decay_override
Tunable.description: The value that the base decay will be overridden with.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The range at which this override will apply. It is inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: _add_bit_on_threshold
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the referenced bit will be added this track reaches the threshold.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The bit and threshold pair.

Tunable.name: bit
Tunable.description: The bit to add.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold at which to add this bit.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: _default_convergence_value
Tunable.description: The value toward which the stat decays.

TunableList.name: _interval_decay_rates
TunableList.description: A list of decay rate overrides. Whenever the value of the stat falls into this range, the decay rate is overridden with the value specified. This overrides the base decay, so all decay modifiers will still apply. The ranges are inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound. Overlapping values are not allowed and will behave in an undefined manner.

TunableTuple.description: The interval/decay_override pair.

Tunable.name: decay_override
Tunable.description: The value that the base decay will be overridden with.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The range at which this override will apply. It is inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: _neutral_bit
Tunable.description: The neutral bit for this relationship track. This is the bit that is displayed when there are holes in the relationship track's bit data.

Tunable.name: _send_telemetry_on_decay_rate_change
Tunable.display: Send Telemetry On Decay Rate Change
Tunable.description: If True, we will send telemetry when this statistic changes its decay rate. By default, we are not sending this telemetry since it's too spammy.

Tunable.name: _send_telemetry_on_value_changed
Tunable.description: If True, telemetry events for up/down state change will be sent.

TunableList.name: ad_data
TunableList.description: A list of Vector2 points that define the desire curve for this relationship track.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableVariant.name: bit_data_tuning
TunableVariant.description: Bit tuning for all the bits that compose this relationship track. The structure tuned here, either 2d or simple track should include bits for all the possible range of the track.

TunableList.name: y_axis_content
TunableList.description: A list of bit sets and thresholds. This represents the Y axis of the matrix.

TunableTuple.description: A threshold for this node in the matrix along with a bit set.

Tunable.name: add_value
Tunable.description: Track score value for the bit to be added.

TunableList.name: bit_set
TunableList.description: The bit set representing the X axis in the matrix for this Y position.

TunableTuple.description: Data for this bit in the track

TunableList.TunableTuple:
<Tunable type="float" name="add_value" class="Tunable" default="100" display="Add Value" description="Track score value for the bit to be added. Since by default all relationships will converge at 0 we must tune depending on the side of the zero we are in. For values greater than 0, this must be greater than remove value. For values less than 0 this must be less than remove value. Example: For the friendship track: GOOD_FRIENDS (value>0) has an add value of 60 As soon as the track value goes >= 60 the bit good friends will be added and the previous active track bit will be removed. DISLIKED (value<0) has an add_value of -20 As soon as the track value goes <= -20 the bit disliked will be added and the previous active track bid will be removed. TUNING MIDDLE VALUES (Ranges approach 0) When tuning a value that goes past 0 (a bit from 10 to -10) it is recommended we tune a positive Bit (10 to 0) and a negative bit (-10 to 0). This way, we can guarantee the rules will consider correct positive and negative directions." tuning_state="NeedsTuning" group="General" />
<Tunable type="float" name="remove_value" class="Tunable" default="-100" display="Remove Value" description="Track score value for the bit to be removed. Since by default all relationships will converge at 0 we must tune depending on the side of the zero we are in. For values greater than 0, this must be less than add value. For values less than 0, this must be greater than add value. For example, on the friendship track: GOOD_FRIENDS (value>0) has a remove value of 55. As soon as the track value goes below 55 the bit good friends will be removed, and the next lowest bit will be added. DISLIKED (value<0) has a remove_value of -15. As soon as the track value goes over -15 the bit disliked will be removed and the next highest bit will be added. TUNING MIDDLE VALUES (Ranges approach 0) When tuning a value that goes past 0 (a bit from 10 to -10) it is recommended we tune a positive Bit (10 to 0) and a negative bit (-10 to 0). This way, we can guarantee the rules will consider correct positive and negative directions." tuning_state="NeedsTuning" group="General" />

Tunable.name: remove_value
Tunable.description: Track score value for the bit to be removed.

Tunable.name: y_axis_track
Tunable.description: The bit track to key the Y axis off of.

TunableTuple.name: bit_intervals
TunableTuple.description: Tuning to represent a track's bit tuning.

TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: The collection of bit intervals to use for this track.

TunableTuple.description: Tuning to represent an interval of a track's score where the given bit is active.

Tunable.name: bit
Tunable.description: The bit that we want to use in this interval.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The interval that this bit should be active for.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: stickiness
Tunable.description: How far past the interval boundaries should we continue using this bit before switching to the next bit? When transitioning between intervals, it can be useful to have the previous value 'stick' beyond the boundaries of the interval. This can help prevent the bits from switching too frequently if the track's value fluctuates around an interval boundary. For example, if we're on bit A, which is tuned for interval -10 to 10, with a stickiness of 5, we won't switch away from A until we're either below -15 or above 15. Once we've left A, we won't re-enter A until we go above -10 or below 10, assuming no other bits have stickiness.

TunableList.name: bit_data

TunableTuple.description: Data for this bit in the track

TunableList.TunableTuple:
<Tunable type="float" name="add_value" class="Tunable" default="100" display="Add Value" description="Track score value for the bit to be added. Since by default all relationships will converge at 0 we must tune depending on the side of the zero we are in. For values greater than 0, this must be greater than remove value. For values less than 0 this must be less than remove value. Example: For the friendship track: GOOD_FRIENDS (value>0) has an add value of 60 As soon as the track value goes >= 60 the bit good friends will be added and the previous active track bit will be removed. DISLIKED (value<0) has an add_value of -20 As soon as the track value goes <= -20 the bit disliked will be added and the previous active track bid will be removed. TUNING MIDDLE VALUES (Ranges approach 0) When tuning a value that goes past 0 (a bit from 10 to -10) it is recommended we tune a positive Bit (10 to 0) and a negative bit (-10 to 0). This way, we can guarantee the rules will consider correct positive and negative directions." tuning_state="NeedsTuning" group="General" />
<Tunable type="float" name="remove_value" class="Tunable" default="-100" display="Remove Value" description="Track score value for the bit to be removed. Since by default all relationships will converge at 0 we must tune depending on the side of the zero we are in. For values greater than 0, this must be less than add value. For values less than 0, this must be greater than add value. For example, on the friendship track: GOOD_FRIENDS (value>0) has a remove value of 55. As soon as the track value goes below 55 the bit good friends will be removed, and the next lowest bit will be added. DISLIKED (value<0) has a remove_value of -15. As soon as the track value goes over -15 the bit disliked will be removed and the next highest bit will be added. TUNING MIDDLE VALUES (Ranges approach 0) When tuning a value that goes past 0 (a bit from 10 to -10) it is recommended we tune a positive Bit (10 to 0) and a negative bit (-10 to 0). This way, we can guarantee the rules will consider correct positive and negative directions." tuning_state="NeedsTuning" group="General" />

Tunable.name: causes_delayed_removal_on_convergence
Tunable.description: If True, this track may cause the relationship to get culled when it reaches convergence. This is not guaranteed, based on the culling rules. Sim relationships will NOT be culled if any of the folling conditions are met: - Sim has any relationship bits that are tuned to prevent this. - The sims are in the same household Note: This value is ignored by the Relationship Culling Story Progression Action.

TunableVariant.name: communicable_by_interaction_tag
TunableVariant.description: List of Tag and loot pairs that will trigger if either the actor or target of an interaction has this statistic to give the first loot whose tag matches any tag on the interaction. So you could do one loot for high risk socials, (tagged as such) a different loot for low risk socials (tagged as such) a third loot for high risk object interactions (licking bowl, maybe?), and fourth loot for low risk object interaction 'generically using an object'.

Tunable.name: loot
Tunable.description: The loot to give.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: Tag on interaction required to apply this loot.

TunableVariant.name: cross_age_multipliers
TunableVariant.description: When tuned, applies cross age multipliers based on age of subject and target on relationship change operations

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The distinctive cross age tuning for gain and loss multipliers.

TunableVariant.name: gain_multipliers
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a CrossAgeTuning tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: Data for cross-age tunable values.

TunableList.name: cross_age_tuning
TunableList.description: A mapping of subject's age to another map of target's age to a tuned value.

TunableEnum.name: subject_age
TunableEnum.description: The subject's age.

TunableList.name: target_age_to_multiplier
TunableList.description: The data associated with the subject's age. Contains a map of the target's age to a multiplier.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The tuned value when this is the target's age.

TunableEnum.name: target_age
TunableEnum.description: The target's age.

Tunable.name: default_value
Tunable.description: The default value, if the mapping requested is not found in the cross age tuning. For example: - for multipliers, you would want to set this to 1 - for modifiers which are additive, you would want to set this to 0

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a CrossAgeTuning tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: loss_multipliers
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a CrossAgeTuning tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: Data for cross-age tunable values.

TunableList.name: cross_age_tuning
TunableList.description: A mapping of subject's age to another map of target's age to a tuned value.

TunableEnum.name: subject_age
TunableEnum.description: The subject's age.

TunableList.name: target_age_to_multiplier
TunableList.description: The data associated with the subject's age. Contains a map of the target's age to a multiplier.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The tuned value when this is the target's age.

TunableEnum.name: target_age
TunableEnum.description: The target's age.

Tunable.name: default_value
Tunable.description: The default value, if the mapping requested is not found in the cross age tuning. For example: - for multipliers, you would want to set this to 1 - for modifiers which are additive, you would want to set this to 0

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a CrossAgeTuning tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: decay_affecting_played_sims
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the decay is only enabled if one or both of the sims in the relationship are played sims.

TunableTuple.name: range_decay_threshold
TunableTuple.description: If relationship value is outside the interval, and neither sim is a played sim, then decay is disabled.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: decay_rate
Tunable.description: The decay rate for this stat (per sim minute).

TunableVariant.name: delay_until_decay_is_applied
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the decay for this track will be disabled whenever the value changes by any means other than decay. It will then be re-enabled after this amount of time (in sim minutes) passes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The amount of time, in sim minutes, that it takes before decay is enabled.

TunableVariant.name: delayed_decay_rate
TunableVariant.description: When enabled contains the tuning for delayed decay. Delayed decay is decay that happens if the value of the commodity hasn't changed in some time.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: All of the tuning for delayed decay rate.

TunableList.name: decay_rate_overrides
TunableList.description: A list of decay rate overrides. Whenever the value of the stat falls into this range, the decay rate is overridden with the value specified. This overrides the base decay, so all decay modifiers will still apply. The ranges are inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound. Overlapping values are not allowed and will behave in an undefined manner.

TunableTuple.description: The interval/decay_override pair.

Tunable.name: decay_override
Tunable.description: The value that the base decay will be overridden with.

Tunable.name: final_delay_override
Tunable.description: The override for how long, in Sim Minutes, the final delay is before the actual decay begins, after displaying the warning.

Tunable.name: initial_delay_override
Tunable.description: The override for how long, in Sim Minutes, the initial delay is before the warning is given about decay starting.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The range at which this override will apply. It is inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: decay_warning
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the notification to show to warn the user that a specific statistic is about to start decaying.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED! Please use custom_mask_target_sim instead. Use InGame/UI/Icons/Dialog/phone_anonymous_caller_icon.png and UI/Gameplay/Phone:UnknownCallerName. If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting_owner
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the owner of the audio sting when the dialog is shown.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant of the interaction who will play the audio_sting.

TunableEnum.name: auto_delete_reason
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's auto-delete reason.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableVariant.name: background_image
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add a background image to the dialog. This will only be used in the case where dialog_bg_style is BG_DYNAMIC_IMAGE.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background image for the family portrait.

TunableVariant.name: custom_mask_target_sim

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

TunableEnum.name: information_level
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's information level.

TunableList.name: override_text_mapping
TunableList.description: If enabled, we will override the TNS text depending on age

Tunable.name: override_string
Tunable.description: The alternate text that will be displayed in the TNS.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: This field is deprecated. Please use 'icon' instead.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.name: primary_icon_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, associate a response to clicking the primary icon.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The response associated to the primary icon.

TunableVariant.name: audio_event_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the audio event sent by this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The button audio event name.

TunableVariant.name: build_buy_filters
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specified category and pack id will be applied in the build buy mode

TunableEnum.description: Category tag to filter in build buy mode Filters include all the buy categories

TunableEnum.name: pack_id
TunableEnum.description: Pack Id to be filtered in build buy mode

TunableVariant.name: button_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the icon to be shown on this button.

Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: loots_for_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify loots to apply and dialog response id for this response.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Loots to apply for the response and dialog response id that will override the original id.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_response_id_override
TunableEnum.description: The dialog response id for this response that will override the default response id. Make sure this is unique for each response.

TunableList.name: loots
TunableList.description: A list of loots that will be applied when the player selects this response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableVariant.name: animal_home_data

TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type_special
TunableTuple.description: The token is a specified string grabbed from a supported participant type that requires special handling. Currently supported are: I. Description of household that lives there.

Tunable.name: delayed_decay_rate
Tunable.description: The decay rate for this stat that starts after a delayed amount of time where the value of the skill does not change.

Tunable.name: final_delay
Tunable.description: Tim, in sim minutes, after the warning is shown that the decay will actually begin.

Tunable.name: initial_delay
Tunable.description: Time, in sim minutes, before the warning that a decay will start will be shown.

Tunable.name: npc_decay
Tunable.description: By default decay doesn't happen for NPC sims. If enabled this will turn on decay of this statistic for NPC sims.

Tunable.name: display_in_sim_profile
Tunable.description: If checked, this relationship track can be shown in the Sim Profile.

Tunable.name: display_popup_priority
Tunable.description: The display popup priority. This is the priority that the relationship score increases will display if there are multiple relationship changes at the same time.

TunableVariant.name: display_priority
TunableVariant.description: The display priority of this relationship track. Tracks with a display priority will be displayed in ascending order in the UI. So a relationship track with a display priority of 1 will show above a relationship track with a display priority of 2. Relationship tracks with the same display priority will show up in potentially non-deterministic ways.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The display priority of the relationship track.

TunableEnum.name: gallery_load_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When owner of commodity is loaded from the gallery, tune this to determine if commodity should be loaded or not. DONT_LOAD = Don't load statistic when owner is coming from gallery LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT = Load only if statistic is being added to an object. If this statistic is tuned as a linked stat to a state, make sure the state is also marked as gallery persisted. i.e. Statistics like fish_freshness or gardening_groth. Switching on this bit has performance implications when downloading a lot from the gallery. Please discuss with a GPE when setting this tunable. LOAD_ONLY_FOR_SIM = Load only if statistic is being added to a sim. LOAD_FOR_ALL = Always load commodity. This has the same ramifications as LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT if owner is an object.

TunableVariant.name: headline
TunableVariant.description: If enabled when this relationship track updates we will display a headline update to the UI.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The headline that we want to send down.

Tunable.name: initial_value
Tunable.description: The initial value for this stat.

Tunable.name: max_value_tuning
Tunable.description: The maximum value for this stat.

TunableEnum.name: min_lod_value
TunableEnum.description: The minimum Sim info LOD necessary for this information to persist on the sim info. e.g. A statistic tuned to FULL will not persist on sims that are lower than FULL. LOD order, high to low, is FULL, INTERACTED, BASE, BACKGROUND, MINIMUM.

Tunable.name: min_value_tuning
Tunable.description: The minimum value for this stat.

Tunable.name: persist_at_convergence
Tunable.description: If unchecked, this track will not be persisted if it is at convergence. This prevents a ton of tracks, in particular short term context tracks, from piling up on relationships with a value of 0. If checked, the track will be persisted even if it is at 0. This should only used on tracks where its presence matters.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_obj_prefence_curve
TunableTuple.description: This curve lets you modify autonomous desire to interact with an object if you have a relationship of this type with the object's crafter.
Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: max_y
Tunable.description: The output will be divided by this value. If this is 0, the maximum value tuned on the curve will be used.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: Value the curve is normalized to as the maximum

Tunable.name: respect_lod_on_add
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will not add the statistic if the LOD value of the Sim is lower than the required LOD of the statistic. Otherwise instanced Sims will be allowed to get statistics of higher LOD values.

TunableVariant.name: species_requirements
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then this relationship track will have species requirements if it is attempting to be given to a pair of Sims.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Two sets of species that determine if a pair of Sims can be given this relationship track. Each pair of Sims must match themselves to the opposite species lists. Example 1: species_list_one = { HUMAN } species_list_two = { DOG } Will pass if a Human and a Dog Sim are being attempted to give this relationship track. This will not be allowed if two Humans or two Dogs are attempted to be given this track. Example 2: species_list_one = { HUMAN } species_list_two = { HUMAN, DOG } Will pass for a relationship between two Humans or a Dog and a Human are attempted to be given this track.

TunableList.name: species_list_one
TunableList.description: A set of species that one of the Sims must have to be given this relationship track.

TunableEnum.description: A species that one of the Sims must have to be given this relationship track.

TunableList.name: species_list_two
TunableList.description: A set of species that one of the Sims must have to be given this relationship track.

TunableEnum.description: A species that one of the Sims must have to be given this relationship track.

Tunable.name: stat_name
Tunable.description: Localized name of this statistic.

Tunable.name: telemetry
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will support telemetry (GAME:STAT:CHNG) for when statistic is changed. For continuous statistics, will be sent when statistic gets updated.

TunableVariant.name: tested_initial_modifier
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a modifier will be applied to the initial value when the track is created.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The test to run and the outcome if test passes.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifiers are applied.

TunableList.name: modifiers
TunableList.description: A list of modifiers to add to Base Value.

Tunable.name: modifier
Tunable.description: The value to apply add to Base Value if the associated tests pass. Can be negative

Tunable.name: multiply_by_count
Tunable.description: If enabled, will multiply the final test result in tests by the numeric result of the test if the tests pass. This only applies for tests that return a count. If you aren't sure if your test returns a count, ask your GPE and they can tell you. Note: This only works on the last test in the test list. If you aren't sure if your tuning is correct, please try it out in game to verify that it behaves correctly.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for the modifier to be applied.

Tunable.name: track_name
Tunable.description: Localized name of this relationship tracker displayed in game.

TunableVariant.name: visible_test_set
TunableVariant.description: If set, tests whether relationship should be sent to client. If no test given, then as soon as track is added to the relationship, it will be visible to client.

TdescFragTag.name: run_test
TdescFragTag.description: If set, tests whether relationship should be sent to client. If no test given, then as soon as track is added to the relationship, it will be visible to client.
